column3: for she was as brave as could be expected of a princess of her age. After a good cry
column5: and brushed the dust from her frock. Oh
column6: what old dust it was! Then she wiped her eyes with her hands
column7: for princesses don't always have their handkerchiefs in their pockets
column8: any more than some other little girls I know of. Next
column10: she resolved on going wisely to work to find her way back: she would walk through the passages
column11: and look in every direction for the stair. This she did
column12: but without success. She went over the same ground again an again without knowing it
column13: for the passages and doors were all alike. At last
column16: she did see a stair. But alas! it went the wrong way: instead of going down
column17: it went up. Frightened as she was
column19: she could not help wishing to see where yet further the stair could lead. It was very narrow
column20: and so steep that she went on like a four-legged creature on her hands and feet.
